title: Ambronay-Priay station
text:
Ambronay-Priay station (<a href="French%20language">French</a>: "Gare de Abronay-Priay") is a French <a href="railway%20station">railway station</a> located in <a href="Communes%20of%20France">commune</a> of <a href="Ambronay">Ambronay</a>, <a href="Ain">Ain</a> <a href="Departments%20of%20France">department</a> in the <a href="Auvergne-Rh%C3%B4ne-Alpes">Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes</a> <a href="Regions%20of%20France">region</a>. As its name suggests, the station also serves the nearby commune of <a href="Priay">Priay</a>. It is located at <a href="kilometric%20point">kilometric point</a> (KP) 61.274 on the <a href="M%C3%A2con-Amb%C3%A9rieu%20railway">Mâcon-Ambérieu railway</a>.
The station was opened in 1856 by the <a href="Chemins%20de%20fer%20de%20Paris%20%C3%A0%20Lyon%20et%20%C3%A0%20la%20M%C3%A9diterran%C3%A9e">Compagnie des chemins de fer de Paris à Lyon et à la Méditerranée</a> (PLM).
As of 2020, the station is owned and operated by the <a href="SNCF">SNCF</a> and served by <a href="TER%20Auvergne-Rh%C3%B4ne-Alpes">TER Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes</a> trains.
History.
In 2019, the <a href="SNCF">SNCF</a> estimated that 9,145 passengers traveled through the station.
Services.
Passenger services.
Classified as a PANG ("point d'accès non géré"), the station is unstaffed without any passenger services.
Train services.
As of 2020, the station is served by <a href="TER%20Auvergne-Rh%C3%B4ne-Alpes">TER Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes</a> line 30 trains between <a href="M%C3%A2con-Ville%20station">Mâcon</a> and <a href="Amb%C3%A9rieu%20station">Ambérieu</a>.
Intermodality.
In addition to passenger vehicle parking, the station is equipped with storage racks and facilities for bicycles.
The station is also served by TER bus and car service in addition to trains.
